intro: Celmisia discolor var. ampla, commonly known as the broad-leaved celmisia, is a perennial herb native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking silver-green foliage. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists alike.
